definitions.definition: To make or become physically unobstructed , uncovered , etc.

subdefinitions.definition: To make or become accessible or clear for passage by moving from a shut position.
examples: Turn the doorknob to open the door.
The door opened all by itself.

subdefinitions.definition: To make or become clear by removal of objects and obstructions , so as to allow passage , access , or visibility .
examples: The icebreaker opened the channel.
The ice melted away and the channel opened .
He opened a path through the undergrowth.
After we left the forest, the country opened into a wide, flat plain.

subdefinitions.definition: To unseal or uncover , or become unsealed or uncovered .
examples: You can open your eyes now!
Her eyes opened wide.

subdefinitions.definition: To spread ; to expand into a wider or looser position.
examples: to open a closed fist
to open matted cotton by separating the fibres
to open a map, book, scroll, padlock
The flower opened in the sunlight.
Her arms opened in welcome.

subdefinitions.definition: To make (a bed ) ready for a patient by folding back the bedcovers .
To reveal one's hand.
examples: Jeff opens his hand revealing a straight flush.

subdefinitions.definition: To move to a position allowing fluid to flow.
subdefinitions.label_groups: transitive , intransitive , engineering , gas and liquid flow , of valve or damper

subdefinitions.definition: To angle (a club , bat or other hitting implement) upwards and/or  (for a right-hander ) clockwise of straight.

definitions.definition: To cause or allow a gap to form or widen.
examples: Mudchester Rovers opened a sizeable lead on their rivals.
A link opened under the strain, and the chain came apart.

subdefinitions.definition: To move to a position preventing electricity from flowing.
subdefinitions.label_groups: transitive , intransitive , electricity , of a switch, fuse or circuit breaker

definitions.definition: To make or become available for use or interaction .

subdefinitions.definition: To make or become operative or available .
examples: He opened a secret bank account in Switzerland.
We're opening the phone lines in ten minutes.
Phone lines will open in ten minutes.

subdefinitions.definition: To make or become accessible to customers , clients or visitors .
examples: I will open the shop an hour early tomorrow.
The summer fete was opened by the mayor.
The shop opens at 9:00.
The fete opened an hour late because of bad weather.

subdefinitions.definition: To make or become receptive or susceptible (to something).
examples: Reading this book will open you to new ideas.
This policy will open the government to criticism.
As he grew older, he opened to new ways of doing things.

subdefinitions.definition: To connect to a resource (a file , document , etc.) for viewing or editing .
examples: I can't open the file because someone else is editing it.

subdefinitions.definition: To turn on ; to switch on .
examples: Please open the lights, the (electric) fan, the TV.

subdefinitions.definition: To start (an event or activity ) as the first performer or actor .
examples: The show was opened by a terrible Elvis impersonator.
Our band opened , and they came on second.
Vermont will open elk hunting season next week.

subdefinitions.definition: To precede another as a performer at a concert or show .
examples: Our band opened for Nirvana.

subdefinitions.definition: Of an event, activity etc., to start or get underway .
examples: The meeting opened with a statement from the chairman.

subdefinitions.definition: To bring up , broach .
examples: I don't want to open that subject.

subdefinitions.definition: To enter upon, begin .
examples: to open a discussion
to open fire upon an enemy
to open trade, or correspondence
to open a case in court, or a meeting

subdefinitions.definition: To start running (a program or application, especially one with a screen-based interface).
examples: Click this icon to open Microsoft Word.

subdefinitions.definition: To begin a side 's innings as one of the first two batsmen .
To bet before any other player has in a particular betting round in a game of poker.
examples: After the first two players fold, Julie opens for $5.

definitions.definition: To make an open relationship or marriage , i.e., with possible additional relationships.
To disclose ; to reveal ; to interpret ; to explain .

main_definition: To make or become physically unobstructed , uncovered , etc.
secondary_definitions: ( transitive , intransitive ) To cause or allow a gap to form or widen.
To make or become available for use or interaction .
( transitive ) To make an open relationship or marriage , i.e., with possible additional relationships.
( obsolete ) To disclose ; to reveal ; to interpret ; to explain .
